<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Sword and Pistol](/Feats.aspx?ID=3159) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Gunslinger" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=406" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 111</row>

**Archetype** [Pistol Phenom](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=120) (Level 4)

</column>

---

You're comfortable wielding a firearm or crossbow in one hand and a melee weapon in the other, combining melee attacks with shots from the firearm. When you make a successful ranged Strike against an enemy within your reach with your one-handed firearm or one-handed crossbow, that enemy is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) against your next melee attack with a one-handed melee weapon.

 When you make a successful melee Strike against an enemy with your one-handed melee weapon, the next ranged Strike you make against that enemy with a one-handed firearm or one-handed crossbow doesn't trigger reactions that would trigger on a ranged attack but not a melee attack, such as [Attack of Opportunity](/Actions.aspx?ID=8). Either of these benefits is lost if not used by the end of your next turn.
name: Sword and Pistol
